item.title: 英美就降低关税的经济协议进行密集会谈
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，英美两国正在就一项经济协议进行深入讨论，该协议将减少部分关税的影响，本周将有一组英国官员前往华盛顿就协议条款进行谈判。【原文：The UK and US are in intensive discussions about an economic agreement that would reduce the impact of some tariffs, with a team of British officials in Washington to negotiate terms this week, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 谷歌为双子座保留最佳搜索数据，而非竞争对手的人工智能应用程序
item.description: 谷歌去年开始向一些人工智能公司提供在搜索结果中锚定聊天机器人回复的方法，但该公司的一位高管作证说，谷歌仍然为自己的人工智能服务 "双子座"（Gemini）保留了关键功能。【原文：Google last year began offering some artificial intelligence firms a way to anchor chatbot responses in its search results, but still reserves key features for its own AI service, Gemini, a company executive testified.】

item.title: 奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage）和保守党就印度税收条款抨击 "双层基尔"（Two-Tier Kier
item.description: 英国改革党领导人奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage）和英国主要反对党保守党就英国与印度达成的新贸易协议抨击英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer），批评其中一项条款将使一些印度工人在英国少缴税。【原文：Reform UK leader Nigel Farage and Britain’s main opposition Conservative Party attacked Prime Minister Keir Starmer over the country’s new trade deal with India, criticizing a provision that would see some Indian workers pay less tax in the UK.】

item.title: Marvell 因经济不景气推迟投资者日活动，股价下挫
item.description: 芯片制造商 Marvell Technology Inc. 以经济 "不确定 "为由下调了收入预期上限并推迟了投资者日活动，该公司股价在盘后交易中下跌超过 6%。【原文：Marvell Technology Inc. shares fell more than 6% in extended trading after the chipmaker cut the high end of its revenue forecast and postponed an investor day event, citing the “uncertain” economy.】

item.title: 交易员押注美联储开始降息需要更长时间
item.description: 交易商押注美联储今年的降息步伐将放缓，经济韧性将迫使政策制定者在2026年更大幅度放宽政策之前保持更长时间的按兵不动。【原文：Traders are betting on a slower pace of interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve this year, with economic resilience forcing policymakers to remain on hold for longer before easing more sharply in 2026.】

item.title: 业绩不佳，超微销售前景黯淡
item.description: 超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer Inc.【原文：Super Micro Computer Inc. gave a sales forecast in the current period that fell short of estimates, disappointing investors after the server maker last week released lackluster preliminary quarterly results for the previous quarter.】

item.title: AMD 预测强劲，表明其市场份额正在扩大
item.description: 受能够创建和运行人工智能软件的高端计算机需求的推动，Nvidia 公司在人工智能处理器领域最强劲的竞争对手先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices Inc.【原文：Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Nvidia Corp.’s closest rival in artificial intelligence processors, gave a strong revenue forecast for the current period, boosted by demand for high-end computers capable of creating and running AI software.】

item.title: OpenAI 的营利性改革远未完成
item.description: 在过去一年的大部分时间里，OpenAI 一直在推进一项复杂的工作，即把自己从一个非营利组织转变成一个对投资者更有吸引力的、更传统的赚钱企业。【原文：For much of the past year, OpenAI has been pushing ahead with a complicated effort to turn itself from a nonprofit into a more conventional moneymaking business that would be more appealing to investors — and doing so over heated objections from former employees, academics and rivals, including Elon Musk.】

item.title: OpenAI 按比例缩减的公司改革尚未完成
item.description: OpenAI 在营利性转型问题上的让步可能不足以赢得一些批评者的支持。但首先...【原文：OpenAI’s concession on its for-profit conversion may not be enough to win over some critics. But first…】

item.title: 卢特尼克通过期货交易所与芝加哥商品交易所抗衡的计划面临延误
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，霍华德-卢特尼克在担任 Cantor Fitzgerald LP 首席执行官时帮助创建的一家期货交易所，由于其清算所 LCH 集团的问题，正努力推出其旗舰产品。【原文：A futures exchange that Howard Lutnick helped found, back when he was the chief executive officer of Cantor Fitzgerald LP, is struggling to launch its flagship product due to problems at its clearing house LCH Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 主要参议员推动立法，赋予美联储独立监督权
item.description: 参议员里克-斯科特（Rick Scott）和伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）正在推动在美联储设立一个独立的监督机构，以 "积极追究 "美联储高级官员的责任。【原文：Senators Rick Scott and Elizabeth Warren are pushing for an independent watchdog at the Federal Reserve to “aggressively hold” senior Fed officials accountable.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官称中国人工智能市场规模有望达到 500 亿美元
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）表示，未来几年中国的人工智能芯片市场规模可能达到 500 亿美元，因此美国公司进入中国市场至关重要。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said that the market for AI chips in China could reach $50 billion in the next couple of years, making it crucial for US companies to have access to the country.】

item.title: 适时看跌药物 ETF，疫苗负责人消息带来回报
item.description: 在维奈-普拉萨德（Vinay Prasad）被任命为美国食品药品管理局生物制品与研究中心主任后，医药股大幅下挫，这使得一笔异常巨大的药品 ETF 看跌押注获得了近 80 万美元的收益。【原文：An unusually large bearish bet on a drug ETF gained almost $800,000 as drug stocks reeled following the appointment of Vinay Prasad as director of the Food and Drug Administration’s Center for Biologics and Research.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会称，Instagram 建议 "新郎 "与未成年人联系
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会在法庭上出示的一份 2019 年内部文件显示，Instagram 的自动化软件系统建议儿童 "诱导者 "在该应用上与未成年人建立联系，使他们更容易找到受害者。【原文：Instagram’s automated software systems recommended that child “groomers” connect with minors on the app, making it easier for them to find victims, according to a 2019 internal document presented in court by the Federal Trade Commission.】

item.title: 学生贷款利率仍将接近经济大衰退时的最高水平
item.description: 下一学年学生贷款的借贷成本可能将接近 15 年来的最高水平。【原文：Borrowing costs on student loans for the next academic year will likely be near a 15-year high.】

item.title: KKR 投资的新月能源公司考虑出售资产，专注于鹰福特和乌因塔盆地
item.description: 据知情人士透露，KKR & Co.支持的美国石油天然气勘探公司新月能源公司（Crescent Energy Co.【原文：Crescent Energy Co., a US oil-and-gas explorer backed by KKR & Co., is looking to slim down its drilling portfolio to focus on its core acreage in the Eagle Ford and Uinta basins, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Rite Aid 将扭亏失败归咎于商店货架空空如也
item.description: Rite Aid 公司将扭亏为盈和迅速破产归咎于无法保证商店货架上的库存，以及低收入顾客转向价格更低的竞争对手购买家庭用品。【原文：Rite Aid blamed its failed turnaround and swift return to bankruptcy on its inability to keep store shelves stocked and a shift by its lower-income customers purchasing household goods at cheaper competitors.】

item.title: 彼得罗佩鲁公司 2025 年的亏损可能比之前预测的更大
item.description: 秘鲁陷入困境的国有石油公司 Petroleos del Peru SA 将在未来几天内下调其财务指导，原因是国际油价下跌以及其最大的炼油厂意外停工。【原文：Peru’s struggling state-owned oil company Petroleos del Peru SA will lower its financial guidance in upcoming days, on lower international prices and an unexpected pause at its largest refinery.】

item.title: 英国为加入 1,500 亿欧元国防基金寻求更坚定的欧盟支持
item.description: 据英国官员和彭博社看到的文件称，英国正在向欧盟施压，要求欧盟更明确地支持英国参与规模达 1,500 亿欧元（1,700 亿美元）的国防基金，因为拟议的安全条约初稿在很大程度上对这一要求只字未提。【原文：The UK is pressing the European Union to more clearly back British participation in a €150 billion ($170 billion) defense fund after the first draft of a proposed security pact was largely silent on the demand, according to UK officials and documents seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 五角大楼监察机构对加沙码头惨败中的设备和训练提出质疑
item.description: 五角大楼的内部监察机构发现，美国陆军和海军在使用价值 2.3 亿美元的浮动码头向加沙运送援助物资的联合行动中未能达到装备和训练标准。【原文：The US Army and Navy failed to meet equipment and training standards in a joint operation to deliver aid to Gaza using a $230 million floating pier, which was plagued with issues and dismantled last summer, the Pentagon’s internal watchdog found.】

item.title: 特朗普称他将制定贸易条款，不需要关税协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他将为希望避免提高关税的美国贸易伙伴规定关税水平，这似乎表明他将放弃进行来回谈判的想法。【原文：US President Donald Trump said he would dictate tariff levels for US trading partners looking to avoid higher duties, appearing to move away from the idea that he would engage in back-and-forth negotiations.】

item.title: 世界最大锌矿卷入中美关税风波
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，由于华盛顿和北京之间的贸易战，世界最大锌矿的所有者正在讨论将美国锌矿的产量从中国转移到其他地方。【原文：The owner of the world’s largest zinc mine is in discussions to reroute output of the US operation away from China due to the trade war between Washington and Beijing, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 动荡加剧，美国企业计划创纪录地回购股票
item.description: 美国公司正计划以历史性的速度回购自己的股票，选择将现金返还给股东，并在极不确定的时期为股价提供一些支撑。【原文：US companies are planning to buy back their own shares at a historic clip, opting to return cash to shareholders and provide some support for their stock price in a time of great uncertainty.】

item.title: BER 称特朗普关税和改革影响南非经济增长
item.description: 南非经济研究局（Bureau For Economic Research）表示，由于国内政局不稳和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税战，南非经济的增长速度可能会大大低于此前的预期。【原文：South Africa’s economy will likely expand at a significantly slower pace than previously anticipated because of domestic political instability and US President Donald Trump’s tariff war, the Bureau For Economic Research said.】

item.title: 房地产紧缩加剧，马德里房价上涨 24
item.description: 4 月份，马德里的房价飙升至有记录以来的最高点，凸显了西班牙日益加深的住宅房地产危机。【原文：Housing prices in Madrid soared the most on record in April, underlining Spain’s deepening residential real estate crisis.】

item.title: 美国在原油暴跌前就已下调石油产量预期
item.description: 在石油价格最近一次跌破每桶 60 美元之前，美国就已经下调了今年的国内原油产量预期，这促使页岩钻探商开始制定缩减计划。【原文：The US cut its forecast for domestic crude production this year even before oil’s latest plunge below $60 a barrel prompted shale drillers to start making plans to retrench.】

item.title: 瑞典播客集团 PodX 以约 3000 万美元收购 Lemonada Media
item.description:
朱莉-路易斯-德雷福斯（Julie Louis-Dreyfus）和梅根-马克尔（Meghan Markle）播客背后的网络将成为 PodX 集团在美国的首次收购

。【原文：

The network behind podcasts from Julie Louis-Dreyfus and Meghan Markle will be PodX Group’s first US-based acquisition

】

item.title: 美国-爱尔兰贸易逆差因关税前药品进口创历史新高
item.description: 美国与爱尔兰的商品贸易逆差在 3 月份飙升至创纪录水平，原因是大量药品和药物流入美国，这很可能是制药公司为提前应对预期关税而采取的先发制人之举。【原文：The US merchandise-trade deficit with Ireland soared to a record in March on a massive inflow of pharmaceutical and medicines, likely a preemptive move by drug companies to front-run expected tariffs.】

item.title: 西班牙与法国、葡萄牙合作使电网更加稳健
item.description: 在全国大停电一周后，西班牙最高能源官员告诉参议员们，西班牙正在与法国和葡萄牙合作加强其电网，并已将互联列为重中之重。【原文：Spain is working with France and Portugal to strengthen its power grid and has made interconnections a high priority, the country’s top energy official told senators a week after a nationwide blackout.】
